shows.title: Dinosaur Fossils / Open Lines
shows.first_half: Billy Doran is a former actor and photographer who is now a dinosaur hunter and the Executive Director of the Museum at Dinosaur Junction in Edwards, Colorado. He'll discuss dinosaur findings in Colorado, and share his passion for discovering fossils. Followed by Open Lines in the latter half.

shows.title: Ouija Board Secrets / Enchanted Plants & the Strange
shows.first_half: In the first half, Ouija board expert Karen A. Dahlman joins Rich Berra (email) to talk about the use of talking boards from a historical perspective, including seances and channeling spirits, to personal experiences of divining wisdom and exploring consciousness. Followed by Varla Ventura, an author, traveler, rotten botanist, and lover of the strange and bizarre. She'll delve into the world of the weird and creepy, and her new work on enchanted plants.
shows.second_half: 6-10pm PT: Art Bell - Somewhere in Time returns to  2/1/96 for a night of Open Lines on such topics as UFOs, hauntings, and weird diseases.

shows.title: Handling Finances / Past & Future Lives
shows.first_half: First Half: Author James Paris joins George Noory to talk about how we can handle money and issues regarding finances in a less stressful way.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Hypnotherapist Bruce Goldberg will delve into past life regression, future life progression, and reincarnation. He'll also discuss the concept of paragression into parallel lives and the entities we can encounter in the fifth dimension.

shows.title: Student Loan Crisis / Ghost Investigations
shows.first_half: First Half: Alan Collinge is the founder of Student Loan Justice, a grassroots organization, and political action committee. He'll discuss the dire student loan problem and offer what he feels would be the best solutions for those who carry this debt.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Founder of the Hollywood Ghost Hunters, Rick McCallum, will discuss his many investigations throughout the US and Scotland, as well as present his research on apparitions and their existence.

shows.title: Conspiracies & the Paranormal / Defeating the Devil
shows.first_half: First Half: Former LAPD detective and author Mike Rothmiller will discuss the many legends and conspiracy theories he's researched. The conversation will include topics such as RFK, JFK, Frank Sinatra, and the time he interrogated Peter Lawford. He'll also bring us information on the paranormal and unexplained.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Evangelist, author, and speaker John Ramirez is a former high-ranking satanic priest who says he served the devil for 25 years. He now teaches believers around the globe how to defeat the devil and prevent him from stealing their identity and robbing them of their purpose and destiny.

shows.title: Simulation Hypothesis / John Titor & Time Travel
shows.first_half: First Half: Scientist and researcher Doug Matzke will discuss consciousness, simulation hypothesis, and telepathy, as well as the cosmic infrastructure for the simulation hypothesis that may underly the universe.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Researcher Oliver Williams shares the story of John Titor, the alleged time traveler from 2036 who was said to arrive in our time in the early 2000s and spoke with multiple people online. Williams will bring to light the many predictions that Titor made that have come true, and the ones that did not.

shows.title: UFO Disclosure / Dream Meanings
shows.first_half: First Half: Advocate, researcher, and ufologist Daniel Sheehan will discuss the latest in the field of UFOs, as well as update how close we are to full disclosure.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Author and dream analyst Patricia Eltinge will present her research on dreaming, how to capture your dreams, what dream symbols mean, and the importance of understanding the meaning of our dreams. She'll expand on the idea that the freedoms afforded to us in the dream realm are unrestrained by our usual, everyday societal constraints, allowing us to experience profound and sometimes scary truths.

shows.title: Improving Sleep / Open Lines
shows.first_half: Health and wellness coach Pam Killeen joins Richard Syrett to discuss sleep habits and health strategies. Followed by Open Lines in the latter half.
